Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Bthepc (B. trutta hepcidin-1, Cys-rich 32%; 4S=S; UCSS1a; natural AMPs; brown trout, fish, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (88.5%) toflat fish hepcidin-1Structure: Stabilized by 4 pairs of S-S bonds.Activity:  disc diffusion method: It inhibits A. baumannii (inhibition area 49.4 mm2), A. salmonicida (55.5 mm2), A. hydrophila (56.91 mm2), P. aeruginosa (50.32 mm2), Gram+ S. aureus (49.26 mm2), E. faecium (40.52 mm2), and fungi C. glabrata (inhibition area 71.24 mm2). Note that a scarmbled peptide also showed reduced inhibition (17.2-27.88 mm2), indicating sequence scrambling did not eliminate the peptide activity.Toxicity: moderate hemolytic HC50 34.71 uM. Updated Jan2020; 7/2021; 2/2022
Literature Information.Author: Huang T, Gu W, Wang B, Zhang Y, Cui L, Yao Z, Zhao C, Xu G.2019
Literature Information.Title: Identification and expression of the hepcidin gene from brown trout (Salmo trutta) and functional analysis of its synthetic peptide.
